TopicTitle: Tourist would like to go on a suborbital flight of the Sun

Articles.Content:
17k kredits for 2 passengers on a suborbital Kerbol dive.

wow.. Let's ignore the 15k m/s dV needed ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

![2015-05-03%2022_26_48-.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/54132241/2015-05-03%2022_26_48-.png)

I thought testing launch clamps on any sort of trajectory was insane... but this? Wow.
But, but only glorious leader of Best Korea can walk on the Sun... ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)
And not just one but *two* customers want to walk on the Sun...
I say let them. Then others will learn not to pay you for stupid ideas they come up with at bachelor parties.

Ha! Love it! Tourists with more money than brains.... Though the prices they're willing to pay really aren't all that well balanced. Would be nice if there was a ticket booth we could click on at Mission Control so we could set the gate fees / ticket prices.

You land during night, do not see problem

This isn't that insane. It doesn't say leave them on a suborbital trajectory, it just says get them there. You can always get to suborbit and then turn around and go straight to orbit again.

It may be challenging, but it's not one of the crazy impossible ones like testing the launch clamps in orbit of the Mun.
They originally wanted to go to Bop, but that flight was all booked up:rolleyes:
I knew I was onto something with my Hitchhiker's Guide to Kerbals. The Sunshippers are real!
